website_summaries.verdict: Tank is not a good size for therapeutic uses, but perfect for beauty or dry skin treatments.
pros: Provides relief for dry skin and hand pain
Protective grate helps keep your hands safe
Ready light lets you know when wax is ready for use
cons: Internal unit gets very hot to melt the wax, so do not use until the indicator light says it's ready

customer_reviews.title: Not safe. 136° wax. Look at my pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this thing 3 times. 1st time I was concerned with how hot it was, I figured maybe my hands were just little on the colder side for the heat. The 2nd time I used it it was really hot. Then the 3rd time I used it it was way to hot, I could feel my hands burning. O I got the wax off as fast as I could. My hands were so red, felt like they were on fire melting.(ok maybe a little man drama) I went toget my Laser Temperature Gun. And the results were ridiculous. 136°. Please beware when using this.
customer_reviews.author: Dicktopia

customer_reviews.title: Soothing relief
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to parafin wax bath by my physical therapist for a thumb injury. This is a good size for hand bath and I've been using it several times a week before doing my exercises. Some reviewers have commented on the temperature being too hot. I thought mine was just fine. Then my dad tried it and pulled his hand out yelling that it was scalding and too hot. Temperature appears to be an individual preference. I have noticed that if you wait a half hour or so after the light is green the temperature seems cooler. If you like hot use as soon as the light is green, otherwise be patient a little while.
customer_reviews.author: MaryB

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it less than one star I would. The ready light came owhen the wax wasn’t even melted. The wax never completely melted at on end. Tested it on my wrist as directed. Put my other hand in it and ended up with a burned wrist. I had bought this for pain relief while I wait to have surgery on a torn ligament in my thumb. The unit isn’t even deep enough for my medium size hand to get wax on the injury. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for months now and it still works great. The wax that comes with it is way better than the refill wax from another brand that I purchased. I use this every night on my wrists for physical therapy reasons and it still works just as well as when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a massage therapist, and I often find my hands sore and achy at the end of the day. I use this every day to re-energize my hands and get them ready for work the next day. My only SLIGHT dissatisfaction is at the amount of time it takes the wax to melt, but I'm not really sure that process can be realistically hastened. It's easy to use and provides the relief for which I was looking.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged it in, the ready light came on in less than an hour, it is supposed to take three hours. Never fully melted the wax, especially around the outsides. I tried to get my hand in the melted parts, but it was way to hot. Also the wax did not stay on my skin, but peeled off within a minute inside the bag. Tried two more days with similar results. Going back. (The picture attached is after being on for about 3 1/2 hours. I took a spatula and plied the wax off the sides.)
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great help for those with Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great product to use for my hands since I have arthritis! The warm wax provides warmth and reduces my pain. It takes sometime for the wax to melt, but you just plan ahead. Easy to warm, directions make this easy to use. Wax can be reused if you are just using this for yourself. Good price for the comfort provided.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: This product functions as promised. It requires more wax ...
customer_reviews.text: This product functions as promised. It requires more wax than is included with this order to fill adequately, so purchase additional wax with your order.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Growing up my super wealthy grandmother had one of these on her kitchen counter for arthritis. I was about 9 years old and would dip my hands in - thought it was the coolest thing ever! To think that for this price I now have one just shows how far technology has come. This works perfectly, and is really helping some soreness I have in my hands (even feet). I have tiny feet (size 5) so I was able to dip them in as well! Amazing purchase, especially for the very reasonable price. I am so glad I got one! Very safe and so easy to use. Anyone could figure it out. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow to melt wax AND TOO hot
customer_reviews.text: So, before I bought this I read the reviews. I understood about the first melt being a long time. The directions say it is there hours...Not so. I had it on for over three and a half hours and maybe a half block of wax was melted. I will turn it on again tomorrow and hopefully it won't take that long to finish the first block of wax. UPDATE..the wax finally melted, but then when I tried to use it, it was too hot!! The max that the manufacturer said it would get was 135 degrees...mine went to 138 and there is no control, but an on and off. So I returned it. So sad!!
customer_reviews.author: reviewerone

customer_reviews.title: Product looked and instructions read more involved than I cared to try.
customer_reviews.text: The product looked well made and I believe it has worked well for some users. I, however, found the total process too involved and took too long to initiate. Having to warm the product for four hours and wear plastic gloves not what I wanted to do. Another thing that was a closer for me was you need to remove rings. I have arthritis with swollen knuckles and can not remove my wedding ring. The product is probably very good. Just not what worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: William E Farris

customer_reviews.title: my cuticles look great. The only thing I don't like is that ...
customer_reviews.text: I work in health care and wash my hands ALL THE TIME, resulting in cuticles that crack and bleed despite frequent manicures and all kinds of creams and ointments.. Since I purchased the HoMedics ParaSpa Paraffin system, my cuticles look great. The only thing I don't like is that I have to leave it plugged in all the time because I like to use it every day and it takes hours for the wax to melt if it's unplugged for long.
customer_reviews.author: Judith H.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I may have received a faulty item. Parafin included in package will not fully melt. When it turns to ready to use mode the temp is already at 140 degrees which is hot not warm to the touch. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful. Helps "trigger finger". Could be warmer.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. Helps my "trigger finger" a bit. I wish it was a little warmer. I leave mine on all day and have used it every day now for a couple of weeks..
customer_reviews.author: feba0

customer_reviews.title: Paraffin wouldn't melt completely
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this product. I opened the box immediately upon receipt and followed all directions to set it up. Checked the wax after an hour and it was beginning to liquefy. I checked back after another hour, and...it hadn't melted any more but the wax has softened somewhat. I checked back after another hour and the wax had hardened along the edges and created a paraffin wax on top. There was liquid wax below. I checked to make sure the level of paraffin was as directed. It was above minimum and below maximum. I checked the wax throughout the next 2 hours and the status was the same as the 3 hour mark.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Garrard

customer_reviews.title: Customer service
customer_reviews.text: Homedics is great company I bought this product it worked great but then did not work at all. Power just did not come on, figured I was out of luck because it has been 10months. Called Homedics they were so nice just verified some numbers and sent me a brand new one really good customer service, would buy homedics again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used hot wax before for hand issues, so this machine seemed like a good option. Instead, it is a cheaply made product that is nearly impossible to use. It takes over an hour for the ready light to appear, but even then there is a thick rim of unmelted wax around the rim of the bowl. If I succeed at melting all of the wax, the wax temperature is so hot that it burns rather than soothes. This one is going back pronto and I will avoid any Homedics products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal Hartford Langhorne

customer_reviews.title: Bogus Product-DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I would give a negative star if it were available. I have not even been able to use this product because it does not work. The instruction state, heat for 3 hours before using, well I did that yet half of the wax was not melted and left no room to even insert your hand. I would return the product but you can not return it once you put the wax in the basin. So, USELESS waste of my hard-earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective - overheats the wax!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my father has one and I used it all the time and loved it, but this one that I ordered overheats the wax WAY, WAY too much. And there is no way to control the temperature and turn it down, only "on" and "off" button. It's so hot it literally burns my hand when I put it in, and it's nothing like the temperature of the one my father has, which is same brand, same exact model.
customer_reviews.author: A. General

customer_reviews.title: It WorksGreat for Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Doctor recommended for arthritis in my fingers. I was a bit apprehensive about dunking my hands in a pot of melted wax. When I finally set it up, which was a simple task, all the wax melted in 5-6 hrs. My house is cold so it took a bit longer. The relief was/is indescribable, I use it at least once daily on each hand. I highly recommend. You only need to find a stable stationary location for the wax bath.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brackett

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so much. I got it for myself. I’m an LMT and sometimes my hands needs some TlC and this thing really helps. I use it at the end of my work week. Good moisturizer too! I turn it on before work and by the time I come home it’s ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! I am returning this for a refund and ...
customer_reviews.text: green light came on after 3 hours + and wax had hardly begun to melt. A few hours later wax still not melted and in one tiny area that was melted I placed my finger into wax and it was beyond burning point. Very disappointed! I am returning this for a refund and will be choosing another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Teddi

customer_reviews.title: Too hot could actually burn you.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, I like the wax that comes with it. What I don’t like is the fact that it’s hot enough to burn you. No one wants to put there hand in there after doing it once.
customer_reviews.author: Fairygirl

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously HOT 😡
customer_reviews.text: I have had several a paraffin hand dip treatments at physical therapy. The wax was heated to a therapeutic temperature providing relief after surgery. This unit has an automatic heat sensor, which is supposed to reach a safe, therapeutic level. I tested on my wrist as owner's manual advised. It was searing hot! I ran for cold water and aloe. Perhaps I had a defective unit, but in good faith, I cannot recommend this unit. I have returned for refund and will continue searching for a safe and effective model.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny B

customer_reviews.title: Will Burn You
customer_reviews.text: This really does not work. Like many of the other reviews state, the wax gets way to hot, but somehow still manages not to fully melt the wax. It's baffling. Left it plugged in, for hours, with the top on the entire time and the wax still will not melt. I don't understand how the wax could be too hot to put your hand in, but not hot enough to fully melt the wax.
customer_reviews.author: ELeeroy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but...
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why but the wax never completely melts before the temperature control automatically shuts off and keeps it at warm. The wax is very hot but only in the middle. It works fine for hands but because the wax is not melted on the edges, it is not easy to do your feet. It is workable although I think the design needs some perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kay

customer_reviews.title: Two in a row out of the box did not work
customer_reviews.text: These units do not melt all of the wax. I followed directions on the first unit using 3 pounds of wax. All of the wax along the edge was still solid. Called HoMedics and they said next time use 2 pounds even though the manual says a minimum of 2.5 pounds. Received the replacement and even with the 2 pounds of wax all along the edge the wax was not melted. There was not enough open melted wax to fit my hand. I will have to look for another manufacturer.....I've lost 3 weeks of therapy by defective equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: too small for hand, wax doesn't all melt
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say use 2 and 1/2 to 3 lbs of wax a d it will take3hours to melt, it will be ready when the green ready light turns on. We uses 2 &1/2 lbs of wax, light came on at 2 hours and only about 1/2 of the wax had melted. Once the green ready light comes on the heat element does not keep melting the wax. Also the tu. Is not big enough to get my entire hand into it.. On the plus side, the treatment did wonders for my skin and did relieve my pain. I am sending back and trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Seiler

customer_reviews.title: For arthritis in the hands
customer_reviews.text: This product did take a few hours to heat up. Once hot the wax is immediate and sustained heat on my hands to help relieve some of the pain. Great deal to have 3 lbs of wax included. The set up was easy just plug it in and drop the wax in then walk away.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT MELT THE WAX!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a zero rating, I would. I followed the directions exactly, but it will not melt totally melt the wax, leaving great clumps in the mix. It is impossible to get my hand covered as the wax chunks are in the way. I left it plugged in for 24 hours, and while the green light was on, the wax was not melted. I am going to return it. Spend a little more a get a better rated product. Wish I would have read the reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Mad Libs

customer_reviews.title: Multiple issues with this product
customer_reviews.text: With the 3 lbs. of new paraffin in the unit and power turned on, 12 hours later (red light off & green light on) there was a 2-inch circumference of unmelted wax around the edge of unit. The middle melted portion was extremely hot. There is no way to put in the grate because of the unmelted wax. So turned the power off for a couple of minutes and turned it on again. Hours later the green light is back on and the unmelted wax is still there while the middle portion is extremely hot. This Paraspa Plus Paraffin Bath is unusable. Because of it's size and weight (and Covid), it will be difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat underpowered.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had spent more$ for better model. Takes hours to warm up. Underpowered but adequate if you turn it on to melt paraffin well before you want to use. Tip... add a little mineral oil to lower the melting point.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Scolding hot and no temperature regulation
customer_reviews.text: I warmed up the wax for 3 hours as recommended but it was scolding hot. As it cooled, the top layer solidified and the liquid layer stayed WAY too hot. There isn’t a way to regulate the extreme heat that it warms to so this product can not be used
customer_reviews.author: Chantil

customer_reviews.title: Help arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I got this item when I was recovering from hand surgery. Using the heated wax helped a lot with pain. I continue to use it for discomfort, but it also seems to be helping with my dry skin and the health of my nails.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes I. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Needs a larger container
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my broken wrist which has a metal plate inserted. Unfortunately, my wrist won't bend enough to put it inside the container. It's fine for those who don't have this problem, but for me, it didn't work, so I gave it away to someone else who needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed can lead to burns.
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model of the Homedics Wax Bath which was extremely good so I was comfortable replacing it with this one. However, it has been redesigned so that this model is essentially unusable. By the time the wax is melted sufficiently to dip a hand into the basin it is hot enough to cause burns. It is too small to immerse a foot, and only a small hand fits into the basin. Due perhaps to the shape even being on many hours does not melt all the was, leaving an unmelted wide rim of wax around the basin's edge.
customer_reviews.author: summer resident

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: All wax does not melt, and when it finally melts some of it, it's too hot to use without burning your hands. I tested it with a finger, and it seemed okay, but when I actually dipped my hand in it was so hot I had to pull the wax off right away and immerse my hand in cold water. There is no temperature gauge and the wax at the top of the container is far cooler than the wax at the bottom. this product is dangerous. I'm returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t melt the wac
customer_reviews.text: Wax does not melt evenly or completely. I’ve had it on for up to 5 hours and wax barely melted although green “ready light” comes on . No where near enough to submerge your hand. I contacted amazon and had it replaced and the new has the exact same issue. Followed instructions to a t. Defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Tangela Hemphill

customer_reviews.title: The temperature of the bath is too high. It ...
customer_reviews.text: The temperature of the bath is too high. It doesn't quite burn, but my hand got very red. I can't use this. I'm throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Regulate
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to adjust the temperature or to see how hot it is. Got burned. I do not recommend this paraffin spa at all.
customer_reviews.author: SurfsUp

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Hard to control the temperature I feel it gets too hot to use then the sides cool down but the center is really too hot. I had one years ago and thought it would be the same but not at all happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kong

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat of a hassle to use, good result though.
customer_reviews.text: takes much longer to melt wax than it states in the instructions. Rather messy as you have to continually scrape wax off the sides & push to middle in order to get it to melt
customer_reviews.author: LPtuyac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Be sure to plan ahead and turn it ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived safely and promptly! Very nice. Be sure to plan ahead and turn it on well before you want to use it! Takes one and a half to two hours to melt wax.
customer_reviews.author: Tillie67

customer_reviews.title: TEMP GETS WAY TOO HOT EVERY TIME
customer_reviews.text: We followed the directions to the letter and the wax was still BURNING hot and we tried it 3 separate times thinking maybe we did it wrong somehow. The temperature got way too high to the point where i consider it a safety issue all three times. There is no way to control the temperature on this item. if you are considering buying this, DON'T.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Croll

customer_reviews.title: Sad and not moisturized
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was so excited to get a paraffin wax tub. I know it’s just a home one but I am disappointed. It took all day for the wax to melt when it should have only been 3 hrs. It’s hot in in sense of burning not a therapeutic heat. The wax is very thick when it dries and cracks off before the 10-20 minute sitting time. I do not recommend this product. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: KFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Great paraffin unit
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this unit to my patients for hand and foot pain relief. Not a huge fan of the wax, however. Usually recommend a medical grade paraffin but the wax will do. Just not as easy to remove and not as penetrating. I had one unit that lasted 7 years of constant use
customer_reviews.author: Susan Goldman-Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time and Money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this parafin bath to help with pain in my hand from an old injury. I ordered one and tried to use it right away. After 4 hours, 1/3 of the wax was not melted. I called the manufacturer and made sure I was using the product correctly. Manufacturer told me it was a defective heating element and to return to amazon for a new bath. Replacement was received and I had the same exact problem! I left it plugged in for 8 hours and still 1/3 of the wax did not melt. Clearly this is a low quality item if a customer receives TWO defective machines.
customer_reviews.author: Julia G

customer_reviews.title: DANGER! You will get burned!
customer_reviews.text: This thing gets extremely hot. Even then, the wax at the top doesn't melt, while the hot wax at the bottom burns you! I'm surprised there haven't been lawsuits filed against Homemedics for injuries caused by this dangerous piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Oh feels so good
customer_reviews.text: Love this paraffin bath. It’s the perfect size for hands and feet. Be sure to put lotion on before you dip in for easy removal. This really help with joint pain and rough skin.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This item burned my hands and feet. My feet didn't hurt as bad as my hands. I followed the directions exactly. The wax was ridiculously hot, more than when I have had this treatment done at a salon. My feet don't hurt like my hands/wrists do.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control and MELT function FAIL
customer_reviews.text: My mother had one of the earlier models and needed a replacement. So I bought the newer model and it worked fine for the first month but then the temperature/melt button stopped working correctly. It would say melting (there was a huge piece of parading needing to be melted) and then it would switch to Ready ??? Other times it would say ready and it was clearly in the MELT function as the temperature was EXTREMELY HOT
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Completely Dissapointing.
customer_reviews.text: I turned on my paraffin bath following the directions- and expecting a 3 hour melting time to begin using it for the first time. After 8 hours of melting time waiting, one of the paraffin blocks is still a block. I better unplugged the bath- completely dissapointed. Hopefully, I get my money back. Very bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: MARTHA RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: bad product
customer_reviews.text: 1. The ready light came on before the wax was melted. 2. The lid didn't fit. 3. When the wax finally melted it was so hot I would have had burns on my hands.. I was thankful I only put in one finger. Frankly, I found nothing good about this product except that I was able to return it very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too small and wax around edge doesn't melt
customer_reviews.text: I am petite and have small hands. I was hoping to dip my hands up to & including my wrists, but this is so small I can hardly even dip my hands. The wax melts and is plenty hot enough in the center of the device, but the edges don't even melt.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Currence

customer_reviews.title: Did not melt wax-
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had read the reviews better before I got this..(this is my second one first one came damaged) left it on with the lid on for 6 hours never did melt all the wax! Thought the brand would be a good thing wrong- lots of temperature reviews (that I see now) to hot not hot enough. Going to return it-(
customer_reviews.author: tschutz75

customer_reviews.title: Check the size compared to your feet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small spa. I purchased this for my husband's feet but it is too small to fit. We had to put the way into a bag to get it on his feet.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: ... 2) the wax that came with the unit is useless! In search of a quality wax to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Having to work harder than planned to 1) heat up the wax and 2) the wax that came with the unit is useless! In search of a quality wax to use with the machine. So far, the wax included clumps, cracks, even when using it properly and using the plastic gloves to secure the wax. The wax is dry and brittle. Can HoMedics recommend an alternative, moisturizing wax?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it and it works very well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to help me heal from a wrist fracture. I really like it and it works very well. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is shallow and it's hard to dip my entire hand up to my wrist into it. Otherwise, I highly recommend this unit for anyone suffering from arthritis or wanting to have really soft, smooth hands.
customer_reviews.author: GraceOfArabia

customer_reviews.title: Therapeutic and soft!
customer_reviews.text: Albeit I wear workout gloves, my hands hurt after I hit the weights at the gym. My 95 pound body hurts! The paraffin wax is soothing and softens my hands. I also use it on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: £orelei C.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I give the object a 3 star because I’m not sure why is not fully warming up but the wax does not melt fully then it tells u if it’s not fully melted to replace lid? What’s does that mean I have been trying to use this thing for two days straight and it’s still won’t go back to heating up very disappointed I’m super upset that I wasted my money in this and it won’t work other than that it is brand new and super cute just sad mine really didn’t work well
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Torred

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't actually set up product until past the return date. It is defective as the wax doesn't melt all the way and the wax becomes way to hot to use. When turning the unit off the wax solidifies too fast to use. After contacting Amazon they will not take it back as I am past the return date. Gave a small courtesy credit as consolation. Very, very disappointed!!! Working with Homedics to return and fix under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ldwhip

customer_reviews.title: Takes 2 to make 1
customer_reviews.text: Got not one broken but TWO broken delivered! Had to take parts from both to get 1 complete working footbath lol woohoo packing and shipping dept...
customer_reviews.author: kylie steele

customer_reviews.title: Get one that you can regulate the temperature
customer_reviews.text: Hated it! No control to regulate heat, got really hot! Tried to let it cool got hard Wax every place, very messy
customer_reviews.author: Carol T.

customer_reviews.title: FEELS SO GOOD TO PAINFUL JOINTS
customer_reviews.text: This is so nice if you have painful joints, I love it. the only problem is it does get very hot so I heat the paraffin then turn off to let cool slightly.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Apodaca

customer_reviews.title: Did not melt the wax long enough to use as directed
customer_reviews.text: Returned .... unhappy. It did not stay on long enough to melt the wax enough to use before it shut off and there is no way to make it turn back on
customer_reviews.author: Deb Howe

customer_reviews.title: Sending back!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it didn't melt all wax nor would it heat up again for a second try. ALSO, IF YOU WEAR CONTACTS YOU WILL LEAVE A WAXY, BLURRY MESS TO THEM FOR DAYS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: This wax machine was horrible
customer_reviews.text: This wax machine was horrible, it had no temperature control and made my hands turn bright red and they felt like they were going to fall off. Even worse the product itself was just as bad when the machine said the wax was ready only half was melted. I got this as a gift for Christmas, I was so excited to use it, but when I used it my hand got burnt. the wax machine was so bad I regifted it to my sister and even she said the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Way too hot
customer_reviews.text: This was so hot, I could barely dip my hands three times, they are red right now, 10 minutes later. I've turned it off and will try if it cools down. I am very disappointed. Tried again , still too hot after 30 minutes off. All the was did not melt either. I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hove

customer_reviews.title: Softer hands
customer_reviews.text: The first time you use it, it does take a few minutes longer than expected but after that it's a breeze. Honestly better than the paraffin dip I had at the spa and it provides a lot of relief.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as i thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Easy to burn fingers on heating plate thru plastic plate cover. It does get very hot, but requires more wax than what comes with it to cover your hand. Smaller than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Mix

customer_reviews.title: Takes time, but works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was working in picture framing. My hands were sore in the evening from the tools, so my husband would turn it on before I got home in the evening so the wax would be melted and I could use it right away.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: This product worked fine once and never heat up again
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine once and never heat up again :( Too much time had passed before I used it again so it was too late to try and return the product. Be wary...
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not purchasing anything made in China..did not realize that it was
customer_reviews.text: Never used it because I saw on the box that it was made in China...not purchasing anything from China. Had I known it was made in China I would never have bothered ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: Proud grandma

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what has changed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I ordered this product in Florida first a few months ago - it worked great. I used this product subsequently in Illinois and it takes forever to heat up the wax. Also, it is supposed to come with 20 liners as stated on the box. I did not get them on this latest order. Please help me understand why this product has changed, and I can change my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amar L Agadi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Takes 3 hrs to heat up and once it does its so hot no matter how long you let it sit that it scolds your hands..unfortunately Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work right
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions for use on this product..............empty wax into container, press ON botton, wait for READY light to come on. I did all of that and the wax did not melt completely. I turned it off and tried again and I had the same results. The parts that were melted were so HOT that I could not put my hand in there. This product is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't beat well
customer_reviews.text: Have to keep it wrapped in a big towel and covered with another towel in order to get the wax to melt. Also have to scrape the sides down. Yesterday I put in new wax and now it barely heats at all! Very poor design- heating element is only on the bottom so the sides don't heat very well. I am on a fixed income so having to buy another is a big deal for me. I am very unhappy with this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Drum

customer_reviews.title: The heated wax was so hot, it hurt and turned my skin red
customer_reviews.text: If I could, I would give this product a zero. One star is too much. I purchased this unit and thought it would be a nice respite as we all quarantine. Sadly, I had to return it. I followed the instructions per the booklet provided. In two failed attempts, I found the wax to be extremely hot and I could barely make a quick dip of my fingers. It was very painful and my skin turned a light red.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: temperature is not evenly distributed
customer_reviews.text: After 24 hours the parafin still not completely melted. The melted portion is extremely hot
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY HAZZARD
customer_reviews.text: I literally put my hand in the wax the MINUTE it was finished melting, and....well, I'm not proud of it, but the curses couldn't be held back. I hope if you are reading reviews to discern whether or not to buy this product, take heed! $40 later with no way to return it, I'm disappointed to be contributing to our nations landfill with this piece of garbage. It was anything BUT soothing!
customer_reviews.author: John Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: This machine never worked right. It left a thick unmelted wax ring around the edges but the wax was super hot. Sent it back. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela E.

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my wax bath!!!
customer_reviews.text: Exxellant product. Im an OR nurse and have over used hands and i look fwd to using this.nightly. Great temp, works well for my hands and stores away without any fuss. Really feels lile heaven on my hands!
customer_reviews.author: Loriann

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Great value, you have to use more than one brick for sure, takes some time love the outcome
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to regulate the temperature of the wax. But I like it super hot! Takes a few hours for wax to melt
customer_reviews.author: sPrinkle189

customer_reviews.title: Wax is too hot!!!
customer_reviews.text: This device heats the wax so hot I can’t put my hand in it. I tried letting it cool down and the wax just congealed on my hand and made a mess. I’m going to purchase a more professional one with temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Gail M. Sailors

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. No heat control and the wax caused second degree burns all over my hand! Total waste. Can’t send it back cuz it’s full of wax now!
customer_reviews.author: Debi VanAlstine

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra bucks & get a good one
customer_reviews.text: This machine has an ON/OFF button. ON melts the wax after 8-9 hours (not the 3 it states) Since it doesn’t have a temp button, it is impossible to know what “room temp” is. I have tried several times but it is still excruciatingly too hot to place my hand/elbow/heel in it. I tried turning it off but the wax begins to harden almost immediately. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t melt the wax
customer_reviews.text: It only ever heated in the middle and never fully melted all the wax to be able to use it. Waste of money because it was never usable.
customer_reviews.author: Rick wolf

customer_reviews.title: Way to hot
customer_reviews.text: For starters the wax did not fully melt the first time we ran it. The second time it melted all of the wax but the wax was extremely hot could only dip my hands once not the 6-10 it suggested. Save your money and buy a higher end paraffin bath.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Not well designed
customer_reviews.text: The heating unit is only on the bottom and the sides are a heavy plastic so the unit does not provide enough heat to completely melt the paraffin. There was a heavy rim of paraffin that was not melted all around the sides. Not a very good design.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Owens

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Cracked
customer_reviews.text: I would like to know if it happens often that you get complains that the Plastic Cracked, it was used for only 4 months, and we can't use it or return it anymore,
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: runs VERY hot
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd machine over the past 15 or 20 years - this has no temp control and is VERY VERY hot. Burning hot. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I am upset that I received a used product which I did not order and never ordered before and had NO idea it was going to be used the box had lots of damage and there were absolutely NO hand liners as it said in the description 20 hand liners come with the it, but there were none at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dad. He had diabetes and his feet crack. He liked it so much it bought the refill wax!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I was wondering if I can find soy wax for topical use instead of the paraffin blocks though.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Item is just average
customer_reviews.text: Item does what it's suppose to do but the lid falls off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Hall

customer_reviews.title: Pos dont order
customer_reviews.text: Seriously a pos doesn’t melt the wax, its smaller than expected and it doesn’t work
customer_reviews.author: Miki

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hot
customer_reviews.text: The wax was extremely hot it didn't melt all the way it was very messy I would not suggest this product
customer_reviews.author: Lawanda Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Wife and Kids like it
customer_reviews.text: This is no gorgeous or robust paraffin wax bath. It is just a simple, inexpensive and large one. I guess NBA players would be able to fit their hands in this with out issue. Like: - Gets the wax hot. - Stable. - Holds a lot of wax. Dislike: - Feels like one 6" drop (empty) and it may never work again. - Kind of a gaudy blue color. Plain white would have been just fine/better.
customer_reviews.author: TMac

customer_reviews.title: I hate it
customer_reviews.text: The worst ever no way to control temperature burned myself so much and I can even get a freaking refund
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

product_meta.title: HoMedics ParaSpa Paraffin Wax Bath | Wax Warmer | Bonus 3 lb Paraffin Wax & 20 Hand Liners | Soothing Hand & Foot Spa | Moisturizing System | Hypoallergenic, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueThe HoMedics para spa plus paraffin bath hydrates and soothes for baby soft skin. A ready light lets you know when wax is ready for use. Safety system with locking lid. Includes 3 pound of hypo-allergenic wax and 20 liners - no scents or dyes added.
feature_bullets: Complete Paraffin Treatment: Help to hydrate dry, cracked skin for a silky smooth and nourished feeling; Dip hands, elbows or Feet into the spa for a hydrating wax bath that easily peels off to reveal younger Looking and Softer skin

Easy TO USE: The green light indicator illuminates when wax is Ready for use so it’s never too hot or too cold; The locking lid acts as a safety barrier and securely protect against Splashing or Spilling
Gentle Heat: Once Ready for use, the Paraffin wax surrounds skin with Soothing heat; The Warming wax bath is great for harsh weather months or vigorous use of dryness prone areas
WHAT’S IN THE BOX: (1) Homedics ParaSpa Paraffin Wax Bath, (3pounds) Paraffin Wax, (20) Hand Liners

At Home SPA: Spot treat problematic dry areas and treat your skin to a soothing spa like treatment any Time, Anywhere; The Soundspa comes with 3 pound of Paraffin wax and 20 disposable hand liners for Multiple at home treatments

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
